infos.name: kitchen
infos.desc:
Okay, so you're in a kitchen, cool, but is it typical? You better believe it is.

 You make out [if c_0 is locked]a locked[else if c_0 is open]an opened[otherwise]a closed[end if] fridge in the corner.[if c_0 is open and there is something in the c_0] The fridge contains [a list of things in the c_0]. There's something strange about this thing being here, but you don't have time to worry about that now.[end if][if c_0 is open and the c_0 contains nothing] The fridge is empty! What a waste of a day![end if] What's that over there? It looks like it's a kitchen cupboard.[if c_1 is open and there is something in the c_1] The kitchen cupboard contains [a list of things in the c_1]. Classic TextWorld.[end if][if c_1 is open and the c_1 contains nothing] The kitchen cupboard is empty! This is the worst thing that could possibly happen, ever![end if] You can make out an oven. You wonder idly who left that here.[if c_2 is open and there is something in the c_2] The oven contains [a list of things in the c_2].[end if][if c_2 is open and the c_2 contains nothing] What a letdown! The oven is empty![end if] Oh wow! Is that what I think it is? It is! It's a trash can. Make a note of this, you might have to put stuff on or in it later on.[if c_3 is open and there is something in the c_3] The trash can contains [a list of things in the c_3].[end if][if c_3 is open and the c_3 contains nothing] The trash can is empty, what a horrible day![end if] You can make out a dishwasher.[if c_4 is open and there is something in the c_4] The dishwasher contains [a list of things in the c_4].[end if][if c_4 is open and the c_4 contains nothing] The dishwasher is empty, what a horrible day![end if] You see [if c_5 is locked]a locked[else if c_5 is open]an opened[otherwise]a closed[end if] cutlery drawer.[if c_5 is open and there is something in the c_5] The cutlery drawer contains [a list of things in the c_5]. Something scurries by right in the corner of your eye. Probably nothing.[end if][if c_5 is open and the c_5 contains nothing] What a letdown! The cutlery drawer is empty![end if] As if things weren't amazing enough already, you can even see a dining table. The dining table is massive.[if there is something on the s_0] On the dining table you can make out [a list of things on the s_0].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_0] The dining table appears to be empty. This always happens![end if] If you haven't noticed it already, there seems to be something there by the wall, it's a ladderback chair. Wow, isn't TextWorld just the best? [if there is something on the s_1]You see [a list of things on the s_1] on the ladderback chair.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_1]Looks like someone's already been here and taken everything off it, though. What, you think everything in TextWorld should have stuff on it?[end if] You make out a dining chair. The dining chair is solid.[if there is something on the s_2] On the dining chair you can see [a list of things on the s_2].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_2] The dining chair appears to be empty. It would have been so cool if there was stuff on the dining chair.[end if] You can see a stove. [if there is something on the s_3]You see [a list of things on the s_3] on the stove. Classic TextWorld.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_3]However, the stove, like an empty stove, has nothing on it.[end if] You see a counter. Wow, isn't TextWorld just the best? [if there is something on the s_4]On the counter you see [a list of things on the s_4].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_4]The counter appears to be empty.[end if]

infos.name: fridge
infos.desc: The [noun] looks solid. [if open]You can see inside it.[else if locked]There is a lock on it and seems impossible to break open.[otherwise]You can't see inside it because the lid's in your way.[end if]

infos.name: kitchen cupboard
infos.desc: The [noun] looks ominous. [if open]It is open.[else if locked]It is locked.[otherwise]It is closed.[end if]

infos.name: oven
infos.desc: The [noun] looks sturdy. [if open]It is open.[else if locked]It is locked.[otherwise]It is closed.[end if]

infos.name: trash can
infos.desc: The [noun] looks stuffy. [if open]You can see inside it.[else if locked]There is a lock on it and seems impossible to bash open.[otherwise]You can't see inside it because the lid's in your way.[end if]

infos.name: dishwasher
infos.desc: The [noun] looks imposing. [if open]You can see inside it.[else if locked]There is a lock on it and seems impossible to break open.[otherwise]You can't see inside it because the lid's in your way.[end if]

infos.name: cutlery drawer
infos.desc: The [noun] looks imposing. [if open]You can see inside it.[else if locked]There is a lock on it and seems impossible to force open.[otherwise]You can't see inside it because the lid's in your way.[end if]

metadata.goal: Look for anything that is out of place and put it away in its proper location.

objective: Welcome to TextWorld! You find yourself in a messy house. Many things are not in their usual location. Let's clean up this place. After you'll have done, this little house is going to be spick and span! Look for anything that is out of place and put it away in its proper location.
